info.title: Intelliflo Consolidated Public APIs (V1)
info.description: Consolidated OpenAPI specification for all Intelliflo Public APIs using V1 swagger endpoints, generated from multiple service swagger definitions.

get.summary: Returns a list of documents for a given client.
get.description:
To filter by tags, append the following to the query string.
            
`..?filter=tag in ('tag1','tag2' )`

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Used to filter documents. Supported fields: id(in, eq, gt, lt), createdat(gt, lt), tag(in), linked_entities.type(in),
             linked_entities.id(in, eq), properties._status.name(eq), properties._clientDocumentId(eq), properties._isEsignatureDocument(eq),
             properties._category.name(eq), properties._subCategory.name(eq), properties._fileType.name(eq)...
             Sample: filter=tag in ('private22', 'tag1')

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Supported fields: id, createdat, title. Supported directions: asc, desc. Sample: orderBy=name desc

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier, used to filter by tenant. Only use under system reach

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of records to retrieve (default 25, max 100)

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

get.summary: Returns a document for a given client and document.
get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve a client's document metadata.
A successful response (200), will also return a `x-iflo-object-location` response header that will contain a pre-authenticated and signed hyperlink value.
Use this hyperlink to download (GET) the associated object content.
*Note:*
* No other headers are required for the object download, a simple GET on the hyperlink is all that is required.
* The object hyperlink is signed with an expiry of 15 minutes, so you have 15 minutes to initiate the download before the link will expire.
* This link will also work directly in a browser by pasting the link into the location bar.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Document identifier.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier, used to filter by tenant. Only use under system reach

x-iflo-object-location.description: signed GET URI for object resource

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The identifier of the expenditure record.

get.summary: Retrieves a client's expenditure record.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The id of the expenditure record.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The identifier for the expenditure record to update.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The updated details for the expenditure.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

get.summary: Returns a list of incomes for a given client.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
The returned list of questions can be filtered using one or more of the following supported fields and operators:
            
* `id` (`in`)
* `employment.id` (`in`, `eq`)
* `frequency` (`in`, `eq`)
* `lastupdated` (`eq`,`ne`,`in`,`gt`,`ge`,`lt`,`le`)
            
Usage examples:
* `filter=id in (1,2)`
* `filter=employment.id eq 22 and id in (1,2)`
* `filter=frequency eq 'Single' or frequency in ('Single','Monthly')`.
            
For further details of how to use the filter parameter see [QueryLang](docs/ApiQueryLang).

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the income categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional. Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero. Defaults to zero if not specified.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Optional. The number of records to retrieve (max 500). Defaults to 100 if not specified.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the income categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: incomeId
parameters.description: The identifier for the income record.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

parameters.name: clientId

parameters.name: incomeId

parameters.name: Prefer

get.summary: Returns a list of product providers.
get.description:
Gets a list of ProductProvider. Some specific filtering is optionally supported:

The following fields are supports for `startswith`:
* `name`

*Example*

`top=5&Skip=1&filter= name startswith '21'`

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource
